name: Malignant Hyperthermia Crisis
chief_complaint: Muscle stiffness and high fever during surgery
treatment: Immediate cessation of triggering agents (volatile anesthetics/succinylcholine)
Rapid IV dantrolene sodium (2.5 mg/kg initially)
Active cooling measures (iced saline, cooling blankets)
prognosis: Mortality <5% with prompt treatment, but risk of renal failure, DIC, or neurological damage if delayed
description: A life-threatening pharmacogenetic disorder of skeletal muscle calcium regulation triggered by volatile anesthetic gases or succinylcholine. Causes uncontrolled skeletal muscle hypermetabolism leading to severe hyperthermia, acidosis, and rhabdomyolysis.
risk_factors: Family history of MH or unexplained anesthesia complications
Central core disease or other myopathies
